title: Easily Print Emails, Attachments, & Calendars in Outlook

steps.title: Open the email message you want to print.
steps.content: Open the email message you want to print. On https://outlook.live.com , navigate to and click the email you want to print. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source In addition to printing emails, you can also download emails from Outlook.com.

steps.title: Click the more options button ••• .
steps.content: Click the more options button ••• . It’s the horizontal three dots button in the top right of the email. A menu will expand. Note that this is different from the horizontal three dots button in the menu bar at the top of the page, above the emails.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This will open the email in a new print preview window.

steps.title: Click the Print button.
steps.content: Click the Print button. It's at the top-left corner of the message. Clicking this button will open the print dialog window.

steps.title: Select a page range (optional).
steps.content: Select a page range (optional). To print a specific page or page range: Click the drop-down menu next to “Pages.” Choose Custom . Enter a page range, single page number, or list of pages.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This will confirm the print settings and print the email. You’re done! You’ve successfully printed the select email.

steps.title: Go to the email you’re going to print.
steps.content: Go to the email you’re going to print. In the Microsoft Outlook app on your PC or Mac, navigate to and click the email you’re looking for. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It’s a tab at the top of the app. This will open the File options menu.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This will open the email in a new print preview window.

steps.title: Select a page range (optional).
steps.content: Select a page range (optional). To print a specific page or page range: Click Print Options below the “Printer” heading. This will open the printer options window. Click the Pages option in the “Page range” section. Enter a page range, single page number, or list of pages. Click Print . This will immediately print the specified pages of the email.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This is to the left of the preview page under the printer icon. Clicking this button will start the printing process for the entire email. Did you know you can unsend an email in Outlook ? This is a useful feature for last minute corrections.

steps.title: Double-click the email in the email list.
steps.content: Double-click the email in the email list. If you just want to print one part of an email message in the Outlook desktop app on your PC or Mac, it's easy. Double-clicking the message will open it in a new window. This method allows you to print a portion of the text in an email.

steps.title: Click the More Move Actions menu.
steps.content: Click the More Move Actions menu. This is the icon of a paper and open blue envelope in the Move section of toolbar. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't see this icon, you're likely using the "Simplified" Outlook toolbar. Click the down-arrow on the right side of the toolbar at the top of the message and select Classic Ribbon . You should now see the "Move" section at the top of the message, and the "More Move Actions" icon (the sheet of paper with a blue envelope).

steps.title: Click View in Browser.
steps.content: Click View in Browser . This will open the email in a new Microsoft Edge window.

steps.title: Use your mouse to highlight the text you want to print.
steps.content: Use your mouse to highlight the text you want to print. Click and drag your cursor to select the portion of the email’s text you want to print.

steps.title: Right-click the selected text and select Print.
steps.content: Right-click the selected text and select Print . The print menu will open. In the print preview, you should see only the selected text.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . It’s at the bottom of the print menu. The selected text from the email will be printed.

steps.title: Go to the email with the attachment you want to print.
steps.content: Go to the email with the attachment you want to print. On the Microsoft Outlook website https://outlook.live.com , navigate to and click the email you’re looking for. To print an attached file, such as a Word document, photo, or PDF, you'll need to download it to your computer first. Then, you'll be able to print the file using that file's default app.

steps.title: Click the drop-down arrow next to the attachment.
steps.content: Click the drop-down arrow next to the attachment. This will open an options menu.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . This will download the attachment to your computer. If prompted to select a download location, choose a place that you can easily access such as the Desktop or Downloads folder.

steps.title: Double-click the downloaded file.
steps.content: Double-click the downloaded file. This will open it in the default app for the file type.

steps.title: Use the app’s menu to print the attachment file.
steps.content: Use the app’s menu to print the attachment file. For example, if you are printing a Microsoft Word document, double-clicking the file should open it in Word. Then you can use Microsoft Word's printing tools to print your file.

steps.title: Open a message with an attachment you want to print.
steps.content: Open a message with an attachment you want to print. In the Microsoft Outlook desktop app on your PC or Mac, navigate to and click the email you’re looking for. You can filter by unread emails if the attachment is in an email marked as unread.

steps.title: Click the drop-down arrow next to the attachment.
steps.content: Click the drop-down arrow next to the attachment. This will open an options menu.

steps.title: Click Quick Print.
steps.content: Click Quick Print . This will open a pop-up window with attachment options. Alternatively, you can click Save As to save the attachment to your computer. If you do this, you can then double-click the file at any time to open it in its default app.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . This is an option in the pop-up window.

steps.title: Select an app and click Always.
steps.content: Select an app and click Always . This will open the attachment in the selected app. You can click Just once if you don’t want to make the selected app the default.

steps.title: Use the app’s menu to print the attachment file.
steps.content: Use the app’s menu to print the attachment file. For example, if you’ve opened a PDF in Google Chrome, click the three-dot menu at the top-right corner of Chrome and select Print to print the PDF .

steps.title: Click the calendar icon on the left side of Outlook.com.
steps.content: Click the calendar icon on the left side of Outlook.com. This displays your calendar in the right panel.

steps.title: Click the Print icon.
steps.content: Click the Print icon. You'll see it just above your calendar. This displays your calendar print options, where you can choose a date range and style for your printed calendar.

steps.title: Choose your calendar view, layout, and time range.
steps.content: Choose your calendar view, layout, and time range. From the "View" menu, you can choose to print individual days, weeks, work weeks, or months. You can also choose a horizontal, vertical, or standard layout, and specify the time range you want to see on your printed pages.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . You'll see this at the bottom-left corner of the window. This opens your computer's print dialog window.

steps.title: Choose your printing options and click Print.
steps.content: Choose your printing options and click Print . This prints your calendar with your selected settings.

steps.title: Click the calendar button.
steps.content: Click the calendar button. It’s the calendar icon located on the left side of the page. This will open the calendar view for Outlook.

steps.title: Click a timescale.
steps.content: Click a timescale. You can select from the following scales at the top of the calendar: Day Work week Week Month

steps.title: Click the File menu and select Print.
steps.content: Click the File menu and select Print . You'll see the File menu at the top of Outlook. Clicking Print in the left panel displays the Print window.

steps.title: Select a printing option under "Settings."
steps.content: Select a printing option under "Settings." You can choose to print in different styles, such as Daily Style , which displays a breakdown of your schedule by day, or Weekly Calendar Style , which gives a more general overview of your appointments for the week. Clicking an option under "Settings" will show you a preview of your printed calendar. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This is to the left of the preview page under the printer icon. Clicking this button will start the printing process for the calendar. Alternatively, you can click Print Options to change additional settings for the print. Click Print in the Print Options window when you’re ready to print.
